articles.title: French cave tells new story about Neanderthals, early humans - Phys.org
articles.description: A hillside dwelling overlooking the picturesque Rhone Valley in southern France proved irresistible for our ancestors, attracting both Neanderthals and modern humans long before the latter were thought to have reached that part of Europe, a new study suggests.

articles.author: Katie Hunt, CNN
articles.title: A tiny tooth unearthed from a French cave is upending what we know about early humans - CNN
articles.description: Unearthed from a French cave, a child's tooth has revealed the earliest evidence of humans -- Homo sapiens -- living in western Europe.
